Read and write pins

Source: R/pin-read-write.R
pin_read.Rd

Use pin_write() to pin an object to board, and pin_read() to retrieve it.

pin_read(board, name)

pin_write(board, x, name = NULL, description = NULL)

Arguments

board

A pin board, created by board_local(), board_rsconnect(), board_github() or other other board_ function.
name

Pin name.
x

An object (typically a data frame) to pin.
description

A text description of the pin; most important for shared boards so that others can understand what the pin contains.

Examples

b <- board_local(tempfile())

b %>% pin_write(mtcars, "mtcars")
b

#> Pin board <pins_board_local>
#> Path: '/tmp/RtmpgIe8T9/file3b7210140600/local'
#> With 1 pins: 'mtcars'

b %>% pin_read("mtcars")

#> # A tibble: 32 x 11
#>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4
#>  2  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4
#>  3  22.8     4  108     93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1
#>  4  21.4     6  258    110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1
#>  5  18.7     8  360    175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2
#>  6  18.1     6  225    105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1
#>  7  14.3     8  360    245  3.21  3.57  15.8     0     0     3     4
#>  8  24.4     4  147.    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2
#>  9  22.8     4  141.    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2
#> 10  19.2     6  168.   123  3.92  3.44  18.3     1     0     4     4
#> # … with 22 more rows
